body: We could add something similar to the language chooser, for being able to select a stylesheet from multiple included ones.

@calmh yes, that would be great.
Do you need the allmost done 2 css files for this Dark-Grey skin? I can put the 2 files here. You can after just put it into a folder for that skin.

I'd accept a pull request with a style selector as described, and the style sheets in question being the first "alternate" style. And probably we'd need to look in a specific folder in the config dirs for more stylesheets and present those as choices as well if they exist, so it's more easily themed by the user. Without that, I think it would be a little bit half baked.

@calmh Unfortunatly, i'm not so good on programing, i'm just good on designing, i can't make pull request. I have done this theme on browser, and not on the raw software.

I'l be very thankfull, if you, or someone, who can programing and adding theme selector would make this on Syncthing.

I can put the 2 css files on my server for download. The Dark-Grey theme is done (i mean, css files)

If someone can do this theme selector, i'm sure, the Syncthing would be look more professional, if there are more themes to select. And i would make more themes after, to have many themes for selecting.

Thanks in advance to every one would do this theme selector. I apreciate work of all peaople doing Syncthing more and more better.

Do someone implements this? And if yes, where i can put, or send the css files? Theme is done, just need to put the css and create theme selector.

Thanks

rename.to: Theme selector for different bundles css files

body: This is now the ticket for the theme selector functionality. :)

Some easy-to-bundle FLOSS themes: https://bootswatch.com/

In Tiki Wiki CMS Groupware, we included them all :-)

@Getron @calmh i would be in for the implementation of the selection dropdown. i am just not quite sure about where to store the custom setting. but i think it should be the same way as synthing stores the language setting, shouldn't it?

@Getron so if you would be so kind to grant me access to a fork where you build the css stuff, that would be great! :)
@snnd That'd be my best guess too.
